snippet: Income for most Americans has not recovered since the recession ended, and, at the recent rate of progress, it won’t for a long time, if ever.
abstract: Editorial contends new census data shows disturbing longer-term trends in America's economic outlook, particularly regarding poverty; maintains progress toward economic health continues to be slow and unreliable due to policy response that never was commensurate with damage caused by recessions and lackluster recoveries since 2000.
lead_paragraph: Income for most Americans has not recovered since the recession ended, and, at the recent rate of progress, it won’t for a long time, if ever.

headline.seo: Incomes for Most Americans Won’t Budge
